definitions.usage_note: 动词，可及物也可不及物。指因疼痛、惊吓或惊讶而发出尖锐短促的叫声。常用于人、狗等动物。过去式/过去分词：yelped。

sentences.en: The dog yelped when I accidentally stepped on its tail.
sentences.zh: 我不小心踩到狗尾巴时，它尖叫了一声。

sentences.en: She yelped in pain as the needle went in.
sentences.zh: 针扎进去时她痛得尖叫起来。

sentences.en: The child yelped with delight when she saw the presents.
sentences.zh: 看到礼物时，孩子高兴得叫了起来。

sentences.en: He yelped in pain when he stubbed his toe.
sentences.zh: 他脚趾撞到时痛得叫了起来。

sentences.en: She yelped with surprise when he jumped out from behind the door.
sentences.zh: 他从门后跳出来时，她惊讶地叫了一声。

sentences.en: The puppy let out a yelp when the door slammed.
sentences.zh: 门砰地关上时，小狗发出一声尖叫。

cry.diffs: cry 较泛；yelp 特指尖锐、短促的叫声

shriek.diffs: shriek 更尖锐、持续时间可能更长；yelp 更短促

sentences.en: She shrieked when she saw the spider.
sentences.zh: 她看见蜘蛛时尖声惊叫。

squeal.diffs: squeal 多指兴奋或惊恐的尖叫；yelp 多与疼痛、惊吓有关

sentences.en: The children squealed with excitement on the roller coaster.
sentences.zh: 孩子们坐过山车时兴奋地尖叫。

whimper.diffs: whimper 更低声、更可怜；yelp 更尖锐、突然

definitions.usage_note: 可数名词。指因疼痛、惊吓或兴奋而发出的尖锐短促的叫声。

sentences.en: A yelp came from the kitchen—someone had burned their finger.
sentences.zh: 厨房传来一声尖叫——有人烫伤了手指。

sentences.en: The dog gave a yelp and ran away.
I heard a yelp of pain from the next room.
sentences.zh: 我听到隔壁传来一声痛苦的尖叫。

sentences.en: There was a yelp of pain when the door closed on his hand.
sentences.zh: 门夹到他手时传来一声痛苦的尖叫。

sentences.en: She let out a yelp of surprise when the lights went on.
sentences.zh: 灯亮时她发出一声惊讶的尖叫。

cry.diffs: cry 较泛；yelp 特指短促尖锐的叫声

sentences.en: A cry for help came from the alley.
sentences.zh: 巷子里传来求救的喊声。

etymology.origin: 源自古英语 gielpan（夸耀、吹嘘），词义演变后指尖锐的叫声。可能受拟声影响。

yelping.rule: yelp 的现在分词作名词/形容词

sentences.en: The yelping of the puppies filled the air.
sentences.zh: 小狗们的叫声此起彼伏。

common_mistakes.explain: Yelp 也是美国评论平台名称。作动词/名词指尖叫时与平台无关，需根据语境区分。

mnemonics.content: yelp 发音近似"叶——"的短促叫声，拟声词，易记。
